transcript:
tone of this man, whom he had almost always before met at balls, amiably smiling in the society of the most brilliant women, surprised Pierre. 
"Yes, I do wish it," said he. 
Willarski bowed his head. 
"Onemore question, Count," hesaid, "which I beg you to answer in all sincerity not as a future Mason but as an honest man: have you renounced your former convictions do you be- lieve in God?" 
Pierre considered. 
"Yes . . . yes, I believe in God," he said. 
"In that case . . ." began Willa
